snippet: The election of Bill de Blasio, the Democratic candidate, amounted to a forceful rejection of the hard-nosed, business-minded style of governance that reigned at City Hall for the past two decades.
abstract: Democratic candidate Bill de Blasio is elected mayor of New York in landslide victory; defeats Republican challenger Joseph J Lhota by margin of about 49 percentage points; his election amounts to a forceful rejection of the hard-nosed, business-minded style of governance that reigned at City Hall for the past two decades, and a sharp leftward turn.

byline.original: By MICHAEL BARBARO and DAVID W. CHEN
byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Michael M. Grynbaum, Javier C. Hernández, Thomas Kaplan, Kate Taylor and Julie Turkewitz.

lead_paragraph: The election of Bill de Blasio, the Democratic candidate, amounted to a forceful rejection of the hard-nosed, business-minded style of governance that reigned at City Hall for the past two decades.

headline.sub: Mayoral Victory Cuts Across Divides, Exit Polls Show
headline.main: De Blasio Is Elected New York City Mayor in Landslide
headline.print_headline: De Blasio Wins Mayor's Race In Landslide; Christie Coasts To 2nd Term as Governor
